intro: Corydalis pauciflora var. foliosa, commonly known as the broad-leaved corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, nodding flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or woodland settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and long-lasting blooms.
